revised_title: A Novel Approach to Convert Heat Energy into Electrical Energy
tldr: The author investigates a new method of converting heat energy into electrical energy using a galvanic cell with chromic chloride as the electrolyte and tin as the positive metal. The electromotive force increases and decreases with temperature changes, with the highest recorded at 0.2607 volts at 197°F. Further research is needed to determine the efficiency of this element.
